meanings.definition: Receive (money, property, or a title) as an heir at the death of the previous holder.
meanings.sent1: She inherited her grandmother's antique jewelry collection.
meanings.sent2: He inherited the family farm when his father passed away.
meanings.sent3: The cat inherited the cozy spot by the fireplace as soon as the dog moved.
meanings.sent4: The new CEO inherited a company in financial turmoil.
meanings.sent5: The young prince inherited the throne and all its responsibilities.

meanings.definition: Derive (a quality, characteristic, or predisposition) genetically from one's parents or ancestors.
meanings.sent1: She inherited her mother's green eyes and her father's sense of humor.
meanings.sent2: He inherited his love for music from his grandfather.
meanings.sent3: The puppy inherited its playful nature from its playful parents.
meanings.sent4: The student inherited a talent for painting from a long line of artists in the family.
meanings.sent5: The athlete inherited speed and agility from generations of runners in the family.
